guide.introduction: You must have finished assembling the main frame before you install the soil loading system.
guide.introduction_rendered:
You must have finished assembling the main frame before you install the soil loading system.

Relevant parts
  • 3/4" galvanized nuts
  • 1/2" lock nuts
  • 1/2" nuts
  • 3/4"x1.5" bolts
  • 3/4"x2.5" bolts
  • 1/2"x2.5" bolts
  • 1/2"x3" bolt
  • 1/2" washers
  • 3/4" washers
  • 1/2"x1" Bolts
Tools
  • Angle grinder
  • Spray paint
  • Vise clamps
  • Welder
  • c clamps
  • torch
  • various wrenches

steps.title: Torch the holes for the hopper mounting plate

lines.text: Clamp the hopper mounting plate to the top of the main frame, positioned as shown, with the cutaways positioned by the leg holders.
lines.text_raw: Clamp the hopper mounting plate to the top of the main frame, positioned as shown, with the cutaways positioned by the leg holders.

lines.text: Clamp it so that the side you grinded down the welds on is touching the main frame.
lines.text_raw: Clamp it so that the side you grinded down the welds on is touching the main frame.

lines.text: Torch the holes thru to the main frame.
lines.text_raw: Torch the holes thru to the main frame.

lines.text: Check that the fit is good by putting bolts in all the holes.
lines.text_raw: Check that the fit is good by putting bolts in all the holes.

lines.text: Grind away all the slag.
lines.text_raw: Grind away all the slag.

lines.text: Bolt the mount to the frame.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the mount to the frame.

steps.title: Install hopper supports and prepare shaker mount.

lines.text: Install the hopper supports into the leg holders.
lines.text_raw: Install the hopper supports into the leg holders.

lines.text: Make sure you put the support with bolts on it on the correct side (refer to your shaker motor and look where you marked it.)
lines.text_raw: Make sure you put the support with bolts on it on the correct side (refer to your shaker motor and look where you marked it.)

lines.text: Their bottom side should be flush with the bottom of the leg holders on the frame.
lines.text_raw: Their bottom side should be flush with the bottom of the leg holders on the frame.

lines.text: Make sure they are orientated correctly. See photo.
lines.text_raw: Make sure they are orientated correctly. See photo.

lines.text: On the side of the shaker motor that you didn't weld bolts for, put a bolt (3/4"x1.5") thru both holes and tighten nuts onto them.
lines.text_raw: On the side of the shaker motor that you didn't weld bolts for, put a bolt (3/4"x1.5") thru both holes and tighten nuts onto them.

lines.text: The nut should be on the side of the mount that the motor will be installed to. (see photo)
lines.text_raw: The nut should be on the side of the mount that the motor will be installed to. (see photo)

steps.title: Tack shaker bolts to hopper support

lines.text: Place the shaker onto the bolts already welded to the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Place the shaker onto the bolts already welded to the hopper supports.

lines.text: Clamp the other side to the hopper support.
lines.text_raw: Clamp the other side to the hopper support.

lines.text: Use a square to make sure the shaker mount is square with the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Use a square to make sure the shaker mount is square with the hopper supports.

lines.text: Tighten nuts onto the side with the welded bolts.
lines.text_raw: Tighten nuts onto the side with the welded bolts.

lines.text: Tack the bolts to the hopper support.
lines.text_raw: Tack the bolts to the hopper support.

lines.text: Make sure you tack them to the hopper support, NOT the shaker mount.
lines.text_raw: Make sure you tack them to the hopper support, NOT the shaker mount.

lines.text: Tack as much as you can from this position.
lines.text_raw: Tack as much as you can from this position.

lines.text: Loosen all the nuts and remove the shaker.
lines.text_raw: Loosen all the nuts and remove the shaker.

lines.text: Protect the threads on the bolts.
lines.text_raw: Protect the threads on the bolts.

lines.text: Weld all the way around the bolt to the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Weld all the way around the bolt to the hopper supports.

lines.text: Don't remount the shaker yet.
lines.text_raw: Don't remount the shaker yet.

steps.title: Clamp the hopper back to supports and torch holes

lines.text: Clamp the 34" tall hopper back to the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Clamp the 34" tall hopper back to the hopper supports.

lines.text: It should be centered horizontally between them, and touching the supports all the way down to the hopper mounting plate.
lines.text_raw: It should be centered horizontally between them, and touching the supports all the way down to the hopper mounting plate.

lines.text: Torch through the holes circled in the diagram, so you torch through the hopper sheet metal.
lines.text_raw: Torch through the holes circled in the diagram, so you torch through the hopper sheet metal.

lines.text: Torch through it on each side, just enough so you have 2 small holes.
lines.text_raw: Torch through it on each side, just enough so you have 2 small holes.

lines.text: Un-clamp the sheet metal and torch 1/2" holes for the bolt.
lines.text_raw: Un-clamp the sheet metal and torch 1/2" holes for the bolt.

steps.title: Remount the first plate, and prepare to weld

lines.text: Grind off the slag from the torching.
lines.text_raw: Grind off the slag from the torching.

lines.text: Mount the first plate back to the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Mount the first plate back to the hopper supports.

lines.text: Use a 1/2"x3" bolt and a nut with washers on each side.
lines.text_raw: Use a 1/2"x3" bolt and a nut with washers on each side.

lines.text: Lift the side pieces and clamp them to the first plate via the hinge plates.
lines.text_raw: Lift the side pieces and clamp them to the first plate via the hinge plates.

lines.text: Minimize the gap between them as much as you can by pushing them together tightly.
lines.text_raw: Minimize the gap between them as much as you can by pushing them together tightly.

steps.title: Weld the hinge plates to the back piece

lines.text: Weld it about 50%, as no more is necessary.
lines.text_raw: Weld it about 50%, as no more is necessary.

lines.text: Weld in 3-4 inch sections.
lines.text_raw: Weld in 3-4 inch sections.

steps.title: Clamp and weld the front piece

lines.text: Clamp the final piece in place to the other side of the side pieces.
lines.text_raw: Clamp the final piece in place to the other side of the side pieces.

lines.text: Yet again, minimize the gap between the two.
lines.text_raw: Yet again, minimize the gap between the two.

lines.text: You may need somebody to get inside of the hopper and push out so you can clamp it well.
lines.text_raw: You may need somebody to get inside of the hopper and push out so you can clamp it well.

lines.text: Weld the last piece like you welded the first one.
lines.text_raw: Weld the last piece like you welded the first one.

steps.title: Place the grate and bolt it to the hopper supports

lines.text: Get a friend or two and lift the grate on top of the hopper.
lines.text_raw: Get a friend or two and lift the grate on top of the hopper.

lines.text: The front end (with the slots) should be as shown, and the grate should be inside of the hopper on the other side (the side with the nuts).
lines.text_raw: The front end (with the slots) should be as shown, and the grate should be inside of the hopper on the other side (the side with the nuts).

lines.text: Have your friend hold the grate in place for the next step, or use C-Clamps to clamp the grate to the supports.
lines.text_raw: Have your friend hold the grate in place for the next step, or use C-Clamps to clamp the grate to the supports.

lines.text: Bolt the grate to the hopper supports (1/2"x 2.5" bolt and lock nut). Bolt both loosely, and then tighten them.
lines.text_raw: Bolt the grate to the hopper supports (1/2"x 2.5" bolt and lock nut). Bolt both loosely, and then tighten them.

lines.text: You'll need 2 washers on each side, as the holes are slots and a 1/2" washer will be too small to prevent the washer from warping. Use a 3/4" washer as the other one.
lines.text_raw: You'll need 2 washers on each side, as the holes are slots and a 1/2" washer will be too small to prevent the washer from warping. Use a 3/4" washer as the other one.

lines.text: You may want to use a large nut in place of a washer on the hopper support side. (see photo)
lines.text_raw: You may want to use a large nut in place of a washer on the hopper support side. (see photo)

lines.text: Loosely bolt the grate supports to the primary arms
lines.text_raw: Loosely bolt the grate supports to the primary arms

lines.text: Bolt (3/4"x2.5" bolt)  The grate mounts through the hopper to the grate.
lines.text_raw: Bolt (3/4"x2.5" bolt)  The grate mounts through the hopper to the grate.

lines.text: Use a 3/4" washer where the bolt goes thru the grate support.
lines.text_raw: Use a 3/4" washer where the bolt goes thru the grate support.

lines.text: Tighten all bolts
lines.text_raw: Tighten all bolts

lines.text: Install the motor on the shaker motor mount if you haven't already.
lines.text_raw: [guide|1728|Install the motor] on the shaker motor mount if you haven't already.

lines.text: Place it on the bolts on the hopper supports.
lines.text_raw: Place it on the bolts on the hopper supports.

lines.text: If for some reason it doesn't fit, torch away whatever metal is preventing it.
lines.text_raw: If for some reason it doesn't fit, torch away whatever metal is preventing it.

lines.text: Tighten nuts onto it.
lines.text_raw: Tighten nuts onto it.

lines.text: Bolt it to the grate.
lines.text_raw: Bolt it to the grate.

guide.summary: This guide covers the installation of the hopper, shaker, and grate to the assembled main frame.
